summary:
Rheumatoid arthritis is a long-term disease where the body's immune system attacks its own joints, causing pain, swelling, and stiffness. It often affects the wrists and hands, and symptoms can spread to other body parts. The exact cause is unknown, but genetics and environment play a role.

Diagnosis is based on symptoms, and treatment aims to reduce pain and inflammation. Medications like painkillers, steroids, and specific arthritis drugs can help. Sometimes, surgery is needed. RA affects millions worldwide, mostly women, and its symptoms can gradually get worse.
title: Rheumatoid arthritis
